meanings.definition: The process of obstructing a blood vessel by an embolus.
meanings.sent1: The embolization of the artery caused a blockage.
meanings.sent2: Doctors performed embolization to stop the bleeding.
meanings.sent3: The embolization of the river with debris created a dam-like effect.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as an embolization, halting the conversation in its tracks.
meanings.sent5: The embolization of the pipe with rust made water flow impossible.

meanings.definition: The introduction of a substance into a blood vessel to block it.
meanings.sent1: During the embolization procedure, a clotting agent is injected.
meanings.sent2: The embolization of the vein was successful in stopping the abnormal flow.
meanings.sent3: The embolization of the straw with a cherry led to a fun experiment.
meanings.sent4: His laughter acted as an embolization, cutting off her sadness.
meanings.sent5: The embolization of the hose with a knot prevented water from passing through.
